intro: Senna cana var. phyllostegia, commonly known as the broad-leaf senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are bipinnate, with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces yellow-orange flowers in clusters. The plant is adapted to well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common ornamental and medicinal species in its native range.
